description:
Zero to Hero - Cyber-Physical Systems Day for JC and Poly students. Guest speaker Jonathan Tan, Managing Director of UnaBiz, spoke on IoT transformations which have taken place in banking and postal services.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Prof Hwee Xian gave an overview of IoT and conducted a hands-on workshop on Smart Sensors, Smart City. Participants used BBC micro:bit for the exercises and SIS students were on hand to assist participants. Participants worked on examples such as smart urban farming (are the vegetables getting enough sun?) And elderly tracking (e.g. has the elderly person with dementia wandered off from his/her caregiver?).
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Next up were SIS alumni  Hanwen and Songwei, where their reasons for joining SIS had the room laughing, along with their respective experience at SIS and work life so far. Participants broke for lunch and visited project booths. And it's a wrap for Day 2 of Zero to Hero
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #IoT #internetofthings #cyberphysicalsystems #smartsensors
location: SMU School of Computing and Information Systems

And elderly tracking (e.g. has the elderly person with dementia wandered off from his/her caregiver?).
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Next up were SIS alumni  Hanwen and Songwei, where their reasons for joining SIS had the room laughing, along with their respective experience at SIS and work life so far. Participants broke for lunch and visited project booths. And it's a wrap for Day 2 of Zero to Hero
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #IoT #internetofthings #cyberphysicalsystems #smartsensors

description:
Zero to Hero - AI Day for JC and Poly students. AI Day opened with Real World AI by Dr Laura Wynter (Director of IBM Research Collaboratory, Singapore) who engaged the audience with Singapore-based examples from transportation and maritime operations. Prof Pradeep covered heuristic search in path planning. Before breaking for lunch and viewing project booths, the audience heard from alumni Koh Kar Chian and Friedemann Ang. Stay tuned for upcoming Cyber-Physical Systems Day and Cybersecurity Day.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #computerscience

description:
This month, Cody is travelling in New Zealand. Thank you @sroylee 
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #CodyTheOwlTravels #justforfun

At 10:30 a.m. when we met at Live Labs, Prof Rajesh had already finished 4 meetings. His first meeting was with a health analytics startup.  Second meeting was with MIT to work on items for startups he’s helping.  Third meeting was with an UX designer to design an app.  Fourth meeting was with the CEO of his startup wrt launch. As his fifth appointment for the day, I asked what the rest of his day was looking like. Rajesh will be meeting a visitor from University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, might be attending a PhD dissertation defense session, followed by an interview with BBC. When I congratulated him on being named ACM Distinguished Member recently, he quipped in a self-deprecating way, “It just means I’m old.”
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Questions and Answers with Rajesh:
Q: What are you currently working on in research?
A: Large scale sensing (passive sensing and analytics mechanisms) to detect and correct stress and depression among students.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: Tell me more about the startups?
A: For the startup on indoor location positioning and location analytics, the technology has been used by a museum, at a convention centre, at some universities in Singapore and overseas and a pest control company. I needed something to manage conference attendance so I came up with a conference app. Turns out there was a demand for a large scale conference app so we’ve sold that to a few people. The app has been used to manage events with 30,000 participants.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: What do you teach at SIS?
A: Software engineering for the longest time and now software project management. There’s an exam coming up then I have to do grading.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: What do you do in your free time?  Do you watch movies?
A: Play with my son. [shows me photo of a super cute 3-year old.] I don’t have time to watch movies. The only time I catch up on a movie is on a plane and I prefer to read.  I read science fiction, fantasy...I read things that generate ideas.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Thank you Rajesh!
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #informationsystems #faculty #geeklife #ACMdistinguishedmember #LiveLabs #mobilecomputing #locationpositioning #locationanalytics #environmentalsensing

IoT: Technology and Applications Poster Day with Profs Hwee Pink and Hwee Xian making their rounds.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Remember that holiday when you couldn’t sleep because it was too noisy? Teams “No Sleep” and “MinusDB” worked on addressing high noise levels with real time monitoring and countering high noise levels with white noise.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
With the aim of improving overall escalator safety and lowering maintenance costs for their stakeholder, “Project Esc” used data from temperature, light (gaps in steps), accelerometer readings (vibration) and range to come up real-time monitoring of escalators and prediction of potential escalator faults.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Alleviating bored children accompanying their parents shopping since Nov 2018, team “BitMonsters” developed a game for their stakeholder where kids wear a device and catch BitMonsters for points which shoppers can redeem for small prizes. Spawning Bitmonsters for capture at different locations within the mall encourages shoppers and their offspring to explore parts of the mall with low traffic.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Drivers have a heads up on available lots at car parks with screens around the city.  Enter “Tissue Issue”, the food court version.  Tissue Issue’s system monitors a food court by camera and tells patrons how many seats are available. The system also detects overcrowded periods and suggests alternative dining timings for patrons.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Team “MarkeThings” worked on monitoring consumer behaviour patterns to see which merchants and promotions are the most effective. In their project, a designated zone would be set up for shoppers to use promo codes to redeem their vouchers.  Data on foot traffic and consumer behaviour is collected for evaluating marketing strategy.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The Quintuplets team looked at child safety at a theme park, With “Easy & Secure Tracking” (E.A.S.T.), kids are less likely to get lost.  Young kids wear beacons in the form of wristbands and receivers placed around the entire theme park allow parents to track their kids’ location.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems#ComputingatSMU #informationsystems #internetofthings #intelligentsystemsdesign #studentlife
location: SMU-X

Remember that holiday when you couldn’t sleep because it was too noisy? Teams “No Sleep” and “MinusDB” worked on addressing high noise levels with real time monitoring and countering high noise levels with white noise.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
With the aim of improving overall escalator safety and lowering maintenance costs for their stakeholder, “Project Esc” used data from temperature, light (gaps in steps), accelerometer readings (vibration) and range to come up real-time monitoring of escalators and prediction of potential escalator faults.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Alleviating bored children accompanying their parents shopping since Nov 2018, team “BitMonsters” developed a game for their stakeholder where kids wear a device and catch BitMonsters for points which shoppers can redeem for small prizes. Spawning Bitmonsters for capture at different locations within the mall encourages shoppers and their offspring to explore parts of the mall with low traffic.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Drivers have a heads up on available lots at car parks with screens around the city.  Enter “Tissue Issue”, the food court version.  Tissue Issue’s system monitors a food court by camera and tells patrons how many seats are available. The system also detects overcrowded periods and suggests alternative dining timings for patrons.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Team “MarkeThings” worked on monitoring consumer behaviour patterns to see which merchants and promotions are the most effective. In their project, a designated zone would be set up for shoppers to use promo codes to redeem their vouchers.  Data on foot traffic and consumer behaviour is collected for evaluating marketing strategy.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The Quintuplets team looked at child safety at a theme park, With “Easy & Secure Tracking” (E.A.S.T.), kids are less likely to get lost.  Young kids wear beacons in the form of wristbands and receivers placed around the entire theme park allow parents to track their kids’ location.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems#ComputingatSMU #informationsystems #internetofthings #intelligentsystemsdesign #studentlife

description:
Wang Wen, Glendys and Benedict spent a week at SMU SIS under the Pioneer Junior College Work Shadowing programme.  They had a glimpse of student life through IS Application Project Presentations by final year SIS students. They were briefed and trained on Project CUDO at Fujitsu-SMU Urban Computing and Engineering (UNiCEN) Corp. Lab. Next up was a stint with SIS Career Strategist and they experimented with the JobSense Application.  Their last stop was with SIS media team where they presented a summary of their reflections and learning points for the past week.  It was a pleasure to host the three of you and we hope you will consider studying at SIS.  Cheers! 
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems#ComputingatSMU #informationsystems #smartcitymanagment #computerscience #faculty #studentlife #geeklife #PJC

The visual analytics team did their project on "Happiness Matters" to visualise what makes a "happier" country.

description:
Hady and his PhD student Tuan Truong delivered a workshop at NUS High on facial expression recognition with neural networks. They covered how to build a classifier using neural networks with an application to recognise facial expressions. The application is able to classify whether a photo with a facial expression indicates emotions such as happiness or sadness.

#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #PreferredAI #computerscience #nushigh #studentlife #geeklife

description:
Venky ran through a typical day in his life as Deputy Dean and it went something like this: MOE query on SIS curriculum through SMU’s Office of Corporate Communications and Marketing. Provost wanted final set of courses under Technology and Society basket and programme direction. Work on presentation for outreach event. Review book chapter on a book he’s co-authored.  Prepare for new course next term - Enterprise Solution Development (core course for Year 2s). Collected fitness tracker to take part in corporate challenge.  Work to be done as President Elect and Conference Committee Chair for AIS SIGEd 2018 Conference (12-13 Dec, in San Francisco). Industry collaboration - train the trainer session. Academic related housekeeping.  Interaction with students.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
3 Questions and Answers with Venky:
Q: Phew. That sounds non-stop. And a lot of moveable parts.  What do you do to decompress?
A: Walking - I do a lot of walking (Mount Faber, Bukit Timah, MacRitchie, etc). Vedic chanting. I appreciate music (western and Indian classical) and plays especially comedy. And I watch Netflix.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: What was the last play you watched?  And what do you watch on Netflix?
A: The play Souvenir (about the infamously bad soprano singer Florence Foster Jenkins) was funny.  On Netflix I’ve been following The Rain and I like history-based drama.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: What are you good at and you enjoy doing?  What would you do even if you weren’t paid for it?
A: I like making people happy. I would teach for free whether in Singapore or abroad.  I am good at taking something complex and making it easy to understand.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

location: SMU School of Computing and Information Systems

description:
Making its debut at SIS Day 2018 -  Cody the owl - SIS’ new mascot. 
Students and alumni who have signed up for SIS Day will receive their very own Cody to cuddle and love when they register tonight at the event.  Students who aren’t able to make it to SIS Day are able to collect their Cody during SIS Welfare Day on 1 Nov.

SIS students, alumni, faculty and staff, please share your SIS experience with us in 3 simple steps:

1. Upload a photo of yourself with Cody - it can be with Cody or simply Cody against a scenic backdrop.

2. Use #CodyTheOwlTravels - give us a shoutout by commenting or tagging us @smu.sis in your entry.

3. Share your photo on Instagram - we hope your profile is set to public so we can see!

FAQs
Q: I am a former/current SIS student, may I have more than one Cody?
A: Nope, one Cody each please.

Q: I am not a SIS student or alumnus/alumna, may I buy Cody?
A. Sorry, Cody is exclusively for SIS students, alumni, faculty and staff.  We’re happy for you to take a photo with Cody though!

#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #informationsystems #smartcitymanagement #computerscience #studentlife #geeklife #SISDay2018 #CodytheOwl #helloCody
location: SMU School of Computing and Information Systems

description:
Lingxiao won the ACM SIGSOFT Impact Paper Award for 2018 for the co-written Deckard paper published in 2007 when he was a PhD student at UC Davis. The name Deckard reveals Lingxiao’s favourite film genre (sci fi) and favourite film (Blade Runner). We had a good discussion (read: he explained, I listened) about code vectorization back in 2007 and today with deep learning.  This post rounds up with a few questions for Lingxiao:
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: What do you teach at SIS?⁣⁣⁣
A: Enterprise Solution Design⁣⁣⁣.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: What do people tell you you’re good at?⁣⁣⁣
A: (Pauses and really thinks about the question.) When I was a younger, my parents praised me for being good at maths, it meant I was paying attention in class (laughs).
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: What do you do in your free time? ⁣⁣⁣
A: (laughs again) Before kids - I used to play badminton and table tennis with my wife. After kids - family activities.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Q: What do you enjoy doing?⁣⁣⁣
A: I enjoy teaching my son to code (Scratch) but I don’t know if he enjoys it (laughs).
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #faculty #geeklife #codevectorization #programanalysis #deeplearning
location: SMU School of Computing and Information Systems

description:
SIS Day is back! 🎉 Celebrate with us as SIS turns 15 🎉
Take the night off and enjoy live food stations 🏓🏓 Engage in our SIGs carnival games🏓🏓 ⌨️⌨️ Turn up the heat in TicTacCode Final ⌨️⌨️ Jio your friends, professors along to the party! 
Date & Time: 26 October, 7-10pm
Location: SIS Level 1 (Near Campus Green)
Admission is Free! 
On top of everything, you can get your SIS Day Golden Ticket! 
https://tinyurl.com/sisday18 (link in bio!) At $5, a SIS golden ticket entitles you to: - A goodie bag with exciting goodies sponsored by Adidas, Coty, Cognizant, DSTA, RIMMEL, Sally Hansen, VISA and many others - Buffet - Arizona Iced Tea - Lucky draw with prizes worth up to $500
location: SMU School of Computing and Information Systems

description:
Yeow Leong is one of our most approachable faculty members and most liked (there's a fan club with hundreds of members) yet he is camera shy. So here are some photos of him without showing his face because we want to keep Yeow Leong happy and approachable. This afternoon's briefing was on the Advanced Placement Programme (Introduction to Programming) to JC students. As long as you're comfortable with maths, you can learn to code.

description:
The final day of the 5-day Data Extraction and Regression Analysis enrichment course for iPREP programme students from SP, NYP and TP kicked off with a guest lecture by Dr Wu Huayu on applications of data science in industries including an example on DBS Group Audit where he currently leads a data science team. The 6 group presentations covered topics: Predicting user ratings from textual reviews (HungryGoWhere.com), How to price your home to attract the highest offers (99.co), Price range prediction for food places (HungryGoWhere.com), Price suggestion for cars (SGCarMart.com) - winning project, Collect data to predict rental price (iProperty.com.sg), Boosting car categorization with machine learning (SGCarMart.com). Every team gave a shout out to their coach from Preferred.AI during their presentation. Well done, everyone!  Before lunch started, Dick (Year 2) and Wei Chen (Year 1) were present for poly students to find out more about life at SIS. 
#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #java #PreferredAI #venomfocusedcrawler #datamodel #datascience #computerscience #algorithms #studentlife #universitylife #geeklife
location: SMU School of Computing and Information Systems

description:
High school students from Xi'an were briefed by Jing on SIS undergraduate programmes. Jing was thinking of a student and recalled a story about a first-year student who failed in her Introduction to Programming course. The student worked hard, got an A+ on his second attempt and went on to become one of SIS' top students.

It's OK to fail. Keep going and don't give up.

#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #universitylife #studentlife #xian #singapore

description:
Data Extraction and Regression Analysis course by SIS research group Preferred.AI is a go! Trainers will be using in-house developed Venom - a focused crawler for deep web. Students have been split into small groups and trainers will be coaching each group. Left to right: Maksim, Wen Jiann, Tuan, Jing Yao, Hady, Andrew and Aghiles. We'll check back on the students at the end of the 5-day course to see what predictive models with interesting and useful applications they come up with. For more info: https://preferred.ai

description:
SIS students were at SG: Digital National Infocomm Media Award Ceremony 2018 to showcase their project. Jazreel, Sean and Wei Xuan attempted to address an urban planning need, e.g. where to place amenities like eldercare in their project on "Centroid-Amenities: An Interactive Visual Analytical Tool for Exploring and Analysing Amenities in Singapore". Find out more at: https://wiki.smu.edu.sg/1718t2is415g1/Centroid-Amenities_Home

description:
Robert was the first speaker for the Singapore Cybersecurity Future Innovation Programme and shared New Cryptographic Techniques for Data Security and Privacy Protection in the Cloud. Using a backdrop of data breaches which have taken centre stage and recent cyber attacks in Singapore, he questioned the validity of the security model. He introduced a security model for cloud data storage system and walked the audience through Ciphertext-Policy Attribute-Based Encryption (CP-ABE) and SIS' research contributions and the benefits of new cryptographic techniques for an organisation.

#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #IEEEFellow #sicw #SCyFI2018 #cryptography #encryption #cybersecurity
location: Suntec Singapore Convention & Exhibition Centre

description:
Paul was interviewed about picking the right Initial Coin Offering to invest in on Channel New Asia’s Money Mind. https://bit.ly/2QCmc2O The main message?  Do your research!  This term Paul is teaching Corporate Banking and Smart Contracts and is also faculty advisor to our student-run Blockchain Club.

description:
SIS students are active in student-run clubs. Here are some from the Blockchain Club and will be taking turns to facilitate workshops this academic year. Left to right: Chaun Siang, Evan, Ashley (LKCSB), Wei En, Dionyous. The Blockchain Club's second workshop on Applications of Blockchain in Key Industries was facilitated by Christel (SoA) and covered issues like payments implementation, identity management with healthcare as an example. Looking forward to their upcoming workshop on Blockchain programming and concepts.

The Blockchain Club's second workshop on Applications of Blockchain in Key Industries was facilitated by Christel (SoA) and covered issues like payments implementation, identity management with healthcare as an example. Looking forward to their upcoming workshop on Blockchain programming and concepts.
#smusis #ComputingatSMU #SchoolofInformationSystems #smublockchainclub #blockchain #payments #healthcare #studentlife
location: SMU Lee Kong Chian School of Business

description:
Jia Peng is teaching a full-day #JavaScript workshop to freshmen today. Q&A with Jia Peng:
1. What's your year/major? - I'm second year IS.
2. First time teaching? - Yup.
3a. What's in it for you to spend your whole Saturday teaching? - It's fun and challenging.
3b.Yeow Leong offered, "Because Yeow Leong made me do it" - LOL. Sure, put that as my answer. 
4. Favourite coding language? - I like all the languages I've learnt so far. For data science I use Python. For web applications I like using JavaScript.
5. What do you do to relax? Any hobby/interest? - I don't relax, LOL. I like reading books!

#smusis #ComputingatSMU #SchoolofInformationSystems #SaturdayinSchool #peerlearning #peersharing #geeklife #coding
location: SMU School of Computing and Information Systems

description:
Former SIS student Henry had a busy night. First he was at Parents' Night at School of Law to share his experience of life as an undergraduate. Next, he shared what he found most memorable about his time at SIS with students from Smart City Management and Technology programme.
From left to right: Steve - Founding Dean of SIS and Vice Provost (Research), Henry - alumnus, Kar Way - Programme Director, BSc (IS) Smart-City Management & Technology Major

#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #SMT #welcomefreshmen #geeklife
location: SMU School of Economics

description:
SIS' newest Special Interest Group Anthill Society kicked off academic year for freshmen with a talk by Steve, founding Dean of SIS and Vice Provost (Research). Steve brought the Smart City Management and Technology students through many real life examples of "adding capacity without building capability" including how to solve last mile problem for goods delivery to malls, traffic control for ships, municipal crowd sourcing, IoT for social innovation and Food AI.

#smusis #schoolofinformationsystems #ComputingatSMU #foundingDean #geeklife #welcomefreshmen #smartcity #cyberphysicality #IoT #machinelearning #reinforcementlearning #neuralnetworks #crowdsourcing #FoodAI

description:
SIS Freshmen at Academic Year Opening Ceremony 2018. Left to right: Hao Jun, Nicole, Brennan. "I am honored to be invited to the SMU annual event, AYOC 2018, and to be able to experience such a formal event before I embark on my first academic year. I am already excited to what’s waiting ahead for me, and after the winter break which many are looking forward to. I am grateful to have met my first batch IS friends through Freshmen Orientation Camp Run 1, before Meta Camp 2018. As what Professor De Meyer mentioned in his speech, in this academic year let’s imagine better, and even better."- Hao Jun

#smusis #SchoolofInformationSystems #ComputingatSMU #AYOC2018 #welcomefreshmen #geeklife #studentlife
location: SMU School of Law

description:

We have seen how much SMU has to offer, and we are eager to embark on our journey in the years ahead!" - Devyn.
